snippet: A Greek magazine publisher and editor who was cleared of violating privacy laws this month after he published the names of more than 2,000 Greeks with Swiss bank accounts is to face trial again.
abstract: Greek magazine publisher Kostas Vaxevanis, who was cleared of violating privacy laws after he published names of more than 2,000 Greeks with Swiss bank accounts, is to face trial again after prosecutors appealed decision.
lead_paragraph: A Greek magazine publisher and editor who was cleared of violating privacy laws this month after he published the names of more than 2,000 Greeks with Swiss bank accounts is to face trial again.

headline.seo: Greek Publisher of Hot Doc to Be Tried Again
headline.main: Greece: A 2nd Trial for Naming Names
headline.print_headline: Greece: A 2nd Trial for Naming Names
